content.p: Each team and individual competitor plays to win their league or competition, but crucially also for BUCS points. These points feed into an overall table where over 140 different HE institutions are ranked. The University of Nottingham is consistently a top performer - we haven't finished outside the top ten since the introduction of the leagues 40 years ago and in 2018-19 we finished 2nd, and before the 2019-20 season was curtailed by Coronavirus, we led the rankings. With over 20 of those teams playing in the top division of their sport and several students tipped for individual gold this season, BUCS offers a fantastic opportunity for spectators to watch top quality sport right on their doorstep. Read below to find out more about what's on! Latest UoN Sport Fixtures & Results Download the BUCS Play App BUCS Score BUCS Big Wednesday BUCS Nationals Most fixtures take place each week on #BUCSWednesday - follow the links above for our latest home fixtures and results or visit BUCS Score to search for a specific league or team. Many sports' national finals culminate on a single day of competition at BUCS Big Wednesday. The very best University of Nottingham athletes also qualify to represent Great Britain or their home country at European and World university events. Organised by the European Universities Sports Association (EUSA) and the International University Sports Federation (FISU), events like the World University Championships attract the best student athletes from over 100 countries across the globe.
